Reviews.Title: “Katino”
Reviews.Author: Catino
Reviews.Content: Great locations near public tranportations and Kudamm. The room was small but well-equipped.

Reviews.Title: “All the luxury with location/art/neatness”
Reviews.Author: muratceyhan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time with my friend in Art otel (XS rooms). Reasonably good prices and worth every penny. Real nice service and great location to kudamm ubahn. Would come down to this great hotel and neighborhood if I return to berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ligaya2
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via Frommers website. Very good location - about 2 blocks from a metro station, walking distance of course to Kudamm, can walk from here to famous KaDeWa shopping center. It is an interesting hotel regarding the furnishings, art posted in the hotel and modern decor. The staff was very helpful. Upon check out, they were willing to keep our luggage in a locked office until time for our train departure. Would recommend this hotel. Rated sleep as average only because hotel is located across a disco / bar which can get loud, but not too bad if one kept windows closed. Could ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic, and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May '08 as part of trip throughout Europe. The hotel is close to the Zoo Garten train station, which serves both the S and U bahn so it's a good springboard to get around all of Berlin. The famous Kudamm and KaDeWe are extremely close by. Chose this hotel cause the photos seemed interesting and the price was right for the couple of nights we stayed in Berlin. As soon as you walk into the lobby you know you're not at an old world hotel. The decor was kind of Warholesque. Splashes of color and eclectic furnishings make up the lobby. Check-in was quick and easy. The front desk personnel spoke English fairly well. We got our key and headed up to our room. The layout was basic and simple, but the decor seemed like something out of the '80s in a weird New Wave way. Very kitschy. Aside from the decor, the room was a comfortable size with a good bathroom. No bath, but shower was a good size to be able to move around in. The room came with 2 full size beds and seemed new as there was no give to them, but were quite comfortable. The entire room was clean and we never felt like there was anything that seemed out of place. Our room did face the street and there was a little bit of noise from the outside, but it seemed that one window wasn't closed properly so noise seeped in. Once we figured that out, we closed it correctly and the problem was solved. Might try something else in the area next time, if the price is right, just to see what kind of rooms and services they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Base quality for adequate price”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel was pleasant, even tough the reception was quite confused with my booking. Kind of a shame as the booking was made directly through the hotel website… The room was nice and big enough; bathroom had all needed and was clean. Internet was kind of slow, but as it is free that it acceptable, even tough not really adequate for Germany. Major downturn was actually the bed. The mattress itself was okay, but the sheets were too short for myself to cover correctly (I am 190cm, not outstanding tall for Germany, neither outstanding small) and I was quite annoyed with this situation. Luckily I was having a double room for single usage, so I could use the second blanket as well and I found a workaround, even tough I did not enjoy this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bob456
Reviews.Content: Good location in west berlin, clean simple rooms, very friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bricabu
Reviews.Content: We're a retired couple and didn't quite know what to expect after we booked our room. A pleasant surprise! We requested a "quiet" room away from the street. The room was excellent in every way including the king size bed. The location was great for our tourist purpose - away from the main party area - still conveniently located near Kurfurstendamm and the trains and buses at Zoologischer Garten. The room was spotless and staff very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience, location location!”
Reviews.Author: Ervis555
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay for a weekend break, great location, just 100m to main shopping street Kurfürstendamm, rooms are OK, but when booking ask for a bigger room, it costs only few euros more but the size is much better! staff is friendly, parking is available 13 euro's per night, breakfast is great, plenty of choice... I will come back to this place again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Much better quality than expected”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: Since my target hotel was fully booked I chose to stay here for that particular night. A package was offered for an xs-room. I arrived at about 19.00 hrs and was welcomed by a very friendly staff member. Since reviewers here said that the road infront of the hotel is noisy I was happy that not only my preference for a high floor was granted, I was even given a room showing to the rear. Infact, the room was extra small! But nevertheless it was clean, well appointed and beside the amenities included in the package (bottle of wine, fruit plate) I also had a bottle of mineral water in my room. The room was stylish and the original art works (painting) gave an extra special touch. The bath room was comparetivley large (shower only). A welcome letter was waiting written in a warm welcoming style and giving some useful information. The hotel bar adjacent to the small lobby looks nice. The bar tender was absent but again the receptionist was very kind and she took my order instead. In the morning the breakfeast room was empty but when filling I realised that it must be noisy when full. And there is not much room between tables. So getting to the buffet might be cumbersome for all parties involved. The breakfast items were of good quality (the choice of bread was a bit small, though). I really enjoyed their coffee, very good quality. Here again, breakfast staff was very kind. All in all, it was an experience much better than expected. I found staff great. This extends to house-keeping as well. Next time I would chose a larger room, especially if I would plan a stay longer than one night only.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money stay”
Reviews.Author: sissaki
Reviews.Content: We were planning to visit Berlin during Easter vacation and we had booked this hotel a couple of months earlier through www.booking.com. We chose this hotel for its location & value for money (prepaid offer: 60E/night without breakfast) The hotel is next to Kumfusterdamm avenue which is the shopping center in West Berlin. Few meters away is Kumfusterdamm station and in 5minutes walking distance is Zoo garden central station (take RE7 or RE14 from/to Schonefeld airport) Close to Zoo garden station is a supermarket where you can get all the basics (it was open on Sunday too) Our room was in 1st floor facing the main road. The room was not very spacious but this wasn't any problem for us. It was very clean, quite and comfortable. THe only negative aspect was that the hotel does not offer free WiFi which I think is essential/basic in our days SInce we didn't take breakfast at the hotel, our only interaction with the staff was during Check In/Out process. They seemed friendly and we didn't have any problem. . I would definately recommend it to friends or visit it again

Reviews.Title: “Calm atmosphere & great location”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Ards
Reviews.Content: - Finding the hotel The hotel itself is easy to find, just a short walk from the Kurfurstendamm or Zoological Garten stations. Once you arrive at Tegel or Schonefeld airport, I would recommend taking the Regional line (No.14) to the Zoological Garten station, from there it is a 5-10 minute walk to Joachimstaler Strasse, the hotel is easily found on the left side of the street, opposite the Metropole. - The hotel The hotel lobby was clean and spacious is appearance, with a really nice bar/seating area. The reception staff are friendly and checking in does not take a long time. I could tell that the hotel was an old hotel revamped into something more modern, with new paintings and artistic stuff placed subtley around the lobby/corridors. There is Wifi available for free the first day but chargeable thereafter if you want it. Would not recommend it's speed if you are working in your room on business, but for a quick Facebook-fix on your mobile it is ok, just use it free the first day and use McDonalds etc the rest of your stay. - Room The double-room I booked was clean, warm and bright. The bathroom, albeit basic, was tidy and looked-after with a great shower. There was the usual small TV with a selection of German stations and free English-speaking news channels and Eurosport, a minibar and very large double bed! Our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking Joachimstaler Strasse. This road was only busy in the mornings. There is a small arcade with a nightclub across the road. As we stayed in the hotel mid-week, this was not really an issue, however on the Wednesday night, the nightclub was busy with drunk people smoking outside up to 6am. This does not really bother me as it is just another noise you should expect on a city break, however if you are a light sleeper or easily irritated, I would recommend asking for a room at the back of the hotel. You may get the odd siren but there is no other overly-audible loud noises, like trains etc. as Joachimstaler Strasse is just off the main road. - Location The hotel is on a street which I guess is mainly offices. On a larger scale, the area is a part of Berlin that has the big city-centre feel, but also feels very safe, as there are many big name shops all along Kurfurstendamm which is only 5 mins walking distance from the hotel, as well as the Europa Centre which is good for shopping and eating out, but not many nightclubs. There is a Lidl in the Metropole arcade across from the hotel, for alcohol/cigarettes there is a Netto on Augsberger Strasse round the corner. There is a small traditional German bar/restaurant right beside the hotel which looked really nice and very reasonably priced, but I did not get the chance to try it. I would recommend Pizzaria Via Veneto, a great italian restaurant on the corner of Lietzenburger Strasse and Bliebtreustrasse. For a better variation of restaurants or nightlife, I would recommend you hop on the train from Zoological Garten to Potzdamer or Alexanderplatz areas. The main sites and nightlife would be around these places. Unrelated, a special recommendation from me would be the free walking tour leaving from starbucks at Brandenburg Gate at 11 or 1. And the best nightlife is beside the Warshaur U-Bahn. The trains only take 10 mins getting you to these places, so I think the hotel is ideally located in a busy but quieter area with very easy and quick access to the main sites. Overall, the hotel is good for it's price and has a calm atmosphere in and around it. It may not look central when checking on the map, but it takes no longer than 15 minutes getting to the main attractionsfrom the second you walk out the front of the building, and there is plenty to see/do around the hotel. I would recommend you do not stay in the hotel for too long though, as every minute you do, you are missing out on seeing something amazing in this awesome city.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, close to public transport but road noisy”
Reviews.Author: maat49
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and tidy; staff helpful; good continental breakfast; five minutes walk from transport links to all Berlin and districts. But had room at the front of the hotel and the building opposite seems to be a music venue/club so loud thumping music from late evening till early hours plus noisy, shouting clubbers arriving and leaving. Try to get room away from the street!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and friendly, with a lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Martin112358
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good order and well-presented (August 2010). The staff are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is excellent. free wi-fi in the room and lounge. The room we had was superb, a quadrant shape with plenty of room and well appointed (admitedly this is a 'superior' room). The Ku'damm area has lots of shops and good restaurants, if your main interest is in Brandenburger Tor / Museuminsel / Reichstag etc you might prefer art'otel Mitte, but I have not been there. The only problem we had was that the hotel is in the Berlin Umweltzone, if you are a driver you need to account for this. If you have a recent car you can buy a plakette that will allow you to drive up to the hotel, if like us you have a ten-year-old diesel you are just not allowed in. I called the hotel and got their only non-English speaking member of staff, which stretched my command of German a bit, but she was very helpful, and suggested parking at Bundespltz. In the event we parked in the Parkhaus next to the U-bahn station at Rathaus Steglitz, which was 2.5 Euros per day and an easy ride on the U-bahn with no changes to Kudamm, or 10 Euros in a cab to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: GiancarloG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, the last two as a result of cancelled flights in Europe. The hotel charged me 29 Euros more for each of these two nights compared with with what I had paid for the first three (and without breakfast being included), which I felt was very unfair in the circumstances. The hotel is of a reasonable standard and well located just a few minutes from the Berlin Zoo, Tiergarten, nice shopping and very handy U2 subway line. Room was small, with no real work space, but clean and modern, bed was comfortable, pillows were unusually baggy but acceptable. Despite being on a busy road and opposite a nightclub, it was quiet in the room. The free wireless internet access was slow and unreliable, though better in the lobby. There was no map of Berlin or other useful visitor information in the room, though staff were generally pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel concerning its rooms is good. They have been refurbished recently and are quite good for the price, although on par with other properties we have stayed in Berlin. What this property lacks is service. There was a problem with check-in which was badly treated, and then after asking some questions about the city the answers of the staff were abrupt and rude. Only one member of the staff, the night receptionist was an exception; she was very friendly and kind, and helped us quite a lot. We wish most of the staff was like her, but unfortunately they need some training sessions. Its location is good for expleoring west Berlin, with a u-bahn station right in front. We had a room in the back and we didn't experience any noise problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Travelers on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: dimpleNYC
Reviews.Content: comfortable and friendly staff. you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Pure 80s. A Little run down.”
Reviews.Author: banane16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located right next to famous Bahnhof Zoo and the Kurfuerstendamm with its endless shopping and entertainment facilities. The hotel itself, however, was opened up in the late Eighties - and it seems nothing much has been done since then. Don´t get me wrong: The staff is helpful and friendly, the rooms are small, but clean. The hotel concept is to include original art of Wolf Vostelle in the lobby and in the rooms, which is kind of nice. I would have preferred a bigger bathroom and a nicer and newer furniture instead. The Radio clock near the bead is glowing, but long out of work, the TV is small and with its 80s "chique" my room felt rather depressing. Its ok for a short stay, however, thought I know that there are many nice and new (!) hotels in Berlin that offer good prices, too. Do ask for a room to the back, though the whole place is rather noisy, because the walls seem to be very thin. The free W-LAN is certainly an advantage, but the connection is rather slow and limited to 200 MB.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lacuadra
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of bustling west Berlin, then this hotel is at the right corner. The Ku-dam is 3 minutes away as well as shopping centers, busy train station, subway and nightlife. The rooms were small and no closets. But we were going to be outside not inside. street can be very noisy, there is a teen-age club in front of the hotel, but only on weekends. And we did not hear much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy hotel in a great location for seeing Berlin”
Reviews.Author: McBay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very tidy and the rooms were nice and spacious. There were friendly staff that spoke good English on hand all the time. There was a great little Bagel shop callen Salamons close by that did a nice breakfast. THe location is really close to the Zoologisher Garten train station so it's really easy to get around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: peterandvivien
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found it a great little hotel. Basically, we liked the ambience of the place. We didn't have any of the problems that some reviewers have reported. The staff were friendly and helpful, no-one tried to get into our room - there is a deadlock that one can use to prevent this. Breakfasts were very good; mostly a cold buffet but a few hot items. We had an all-in price for B&B so the cost wasn't an issue. The bed was huge which made the room look smaller than is was but it was well equiped with two chairs, LCD TV, wardrobe a cupboard for smaller clothes a mini bar and writing shelf. The design was quite funky all round. It is also in a great location. Although it is to the southwest of Teirgarten by the Zoo, there is good access to all parts of the city centre by S-Bahn, 2 U-Bahn lines or numerous buses. The 100 and 200 bus routes are particularly useful for the tourist sights and go from the Zooloischer Garten Station just up the road from the hotel. We would certainly stay there again when next in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: GermanKatze
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cute, with a great breakfast. Very good location, clean rooms, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't mind voyeuristic cleaners.”
Reviews.Author: imonlynapping
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a 6 week inter-rail trip. The location and price were excellent, and we rather liked the very kitsch interiors. However: After our 1st night, we were awoken at about 8 o clock by a series of incredibly loud bangs, which sounded like building work. The bangs went on for over an hour. At first we weren't sure what the noise was, so we rang reception to ask what they were and how long they would continue for and they just said they would 'send someone up' (which they never did). We went and had a look and saw that the building work was going on on our floor very close to our room- it must have been planned, so we thought it was a little inconsiderate to put us there. The next day, at about 9, somebody knocked on the door- I wasn't wearing anything-at all- so very clearly shouted (politely!) to hold on. Even if the person did not speak English, the tone of my voice made it clear I did not want to be disturbed. About a second later, this man just opened the door and I had to practically throw myself into a towel to protect my decency! He was dressed in incredibly scruffy, dirty clothes (not like a uniform) and had a dirty bucket behind him and rag in his hand. He just laughed and shut my door. I found this quite upsetting because I wanted to know how he had a keycard to my room, but I just put it down to 'one of those things' and went back to bed. About half an hour later *exactly the same thing happened.* The whole scenario played itself out again entirely. This really p*ssed me off, and actually frightened me a little bit, so when we went downstairs we told reception (politely, I am rather meek by nature) who did not apologise or seem to care at all. The two receptionists looked at each other and GIGGLED, and then one turned to me and with a look of disdain said, "oh, do you mean the BLACK man". Without meaning to sound paranoid, it was clear she basically thought I was being racist by complaining (total bollocks, I was complaining about a random man walking into my room at 9 am with no explanation). She told me he was a cleaner, and I thought well OK fair enough he was employed by the hotel, but he was dressed and acted completely unprofessionally, and who cleans a room at 9am? I tried to explain my concern but both the women at reception were just completely uninterested and did not care at all. In fact, throughout our stay, we found the service utterly terrible, staff very rude and dismissive, and who seemed infuriated that you might actually require some help. We (my boyfriend and I) have stayed in a LOT of hotels (it's sort of a hobby), and being only 19 we generally don't find alot to complain about and can adapt happily to most situations, but this one undoubtedly had the worst service out of about 40+ hotels we've stayed in in the last 3 years.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: mpdesjardins
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for 60 USD / night, which is a quite a good rate for a 3-star hotel in the Tiergarten area. The hotel is perfectly located, at walk distance of 5 train stations, Berlin Zoo and plenty of great stores and restaurants (for a quick yet tasteful and inexpensive meal, try Vapiano on the corner of Joachimstaler and Augsburger Streets). My standard double room was perfect and actually pretty nice for a 3-star hotel. It was rather small but tastefully decorated, well equipped (safe, minifridge, flatscreen tv) and as clean as it could be. This hotel actually looks good all around as it has been refurbished recently. Staff was quite helpful and courteous during my stay, providing me with many directions and German language tips. I would raise only one concern about the Internet connection that was not available in rooms and very weak in the lobby during my whole stay. But all in all Art'otel Berlin Kudamm is a well-advised pick.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Bromilee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location just 2 minutes from the Kurfustendam which is a street lined with stunning shops, restaurants, cafe's, bars, theatre's and much more. Nearby train station and undrground are (Zoolischer Garten and Kurfustendam) which basically connect you to anywhere you want to go in the city and is the most reliable public transport system i've ever experienced. The Hotel reception is spotless and extremely modern. The many staff at the stunning bar area and at the front desk are extremely polite and helpful and can speak good english. A map of the area is available on request and a free drink is offered to each guest which is rare for hotels to do. The rooms are immaculate and have a minibar which is handy. There is soft drinks, alcohol, sweets, chocolate etc and not too expensive either. The shower is fantastic and really powerful and the temperature can be adjusted to make a huge difference. Beds are comfortable and rooms are serviced on a daily basis no matter how long you stay. Digital Television and radio in room and kettle and safe. Not huge rooms but ideal for couples. Berlin is a fantastic place, especially christmas season because the markets and the atmosphere is magical. Not only did we adore the place and plan on going back but we had the pleasures of staying at the Art'otel for three nights and we are pleased to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Art'otel was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Flygirl7Nyc
Reviews.Content: Overall wonderful hotel! Clean, attractive decor. hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Great Breakfast but a bit costly 14 euros a person. room was clean the bathroom was clean the shower had great water pressure and temp was perfect (no tub). Mini Bar and snacks in the room, replenished daily. bed was firm but comfortable as well as 2 different styles of pillows (4 all together) and two separate comforters. Room had a safe in which you make the code for! hotel had a room in the lobby area to iron your clothes, so no iron in room. my only comlaint was the A/C. it didn't get cool enough. and if you left the window open (which i don't recomend) you can hear all the street noise till the wee hrs of the morning. once the windows were closed you heard no outside noise! we stayed there the second week of oct. so it wasn't hot outside. yet we like to sleep with cool air going. like a minute walk to the Kurfursten underground station. 5 mins to Zoologischer train station (One of the Main stations). Lots of great shopping in the area. So overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean, cheerful”
Reviews.Author: MattMilan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through TravelSupermarket and were looking for the cheapest 3 star hotel we could find - expectations were not high at 55 euro a night. The location is great if you want to do West Berlin - the zoo is on your doorstep. The area is a little bit sleazy (sex museum, prostitution etc.) but not threatening and it is quite lively during the day. It is a terrible loction for nightlife (go further east). The lobby is quite stylish with a small bar and a very friendly reception. There is a computer there for free internet access as well as reliable wi-fi. The rooms are quite small but very clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are good too. This place is fab if you can get a bargain deal. It is not an art hotel. There are a few paintings and other pieces of art in the public areas and in the bedroom but they are little more exciting than in a travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good product - would need better staff”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveller-nice
Reviews.Content: I book directly from the chain website and got a decent price for the period. Since I was travelling with my business partner, I booked a twin-bedded room. For those who are not familiar with that, it means that the rooms has two separate beds, each one for 1 person. On arrival, we have been allocated a room, nothing was said. We went up to the room and discovered the room only had one large bed and that there was no possibility at all to get two beds. Sometimes this is in fact two mattress with a zip between. I went down to the reception and got several consecutive bad answers. First one was "twin room does not mean two beds, it means two persons". I answered that I had been working in hospitality + have been travelling over the world and that they were lying to me. 2nd answer: "we never confirmed a twin room, it was just a preference." I had to switch on my laptop and got the confirmation where it was written "twin room confirmed" 3rd answer: "we have no twin room. That's it and you'll change tomorrow". Then I said that if I was her, I would first apologize for my mistake and that second I would check and check again every other reservation and find a solution. I would at least look embarassed. She was not at all and I was just bothering her. From there, I did ask to check name by name the next arrivals until we could find a single person having a twin room. While doing that, the guy next to me was alone and was checking in a twin room. I asked him to switch and he kindly accepted. The girl there was on duty, she refused to call a manager, she refused to call anyone else, she refused to book me a room in another hotel and she did not express any interest about my situation. She has no understanding of her guest needs and she lies. Otherwise the hotel was good, good value, good breakfast, good location, good room size for Berlin. The bar was okay. Bad point: wireless access only worked in the bar, which means we were about 12/15 people at same time in the abr, not for drinking but simply for working

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable - ticked all the boxes for the price charged”
Reviews.Author: Rob19822891
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Art Hotel on kudamm, Berlin. I found the hotel to be very acceptable with helpful staff, comfortable / well fitted / clean rooms, attractive bar area and an unsupassed location for shops (KaDeWe - 5 mins walk / Kurfurstendamm - 30 second walk) Transport links (the Zoo' S bhan & bus terminal - 5 mins walk / U-Bhan -30 second walk / Tigel Aiport - €15>20 taxi / schonefeld - €30 > 35). This hotel provided me with eveything i needed for my stay as when i travel to locations around the world i do so to enjoy the destination, not the hotel (which so many people who have written reviews on this hotel seem to have done). my advice to these people is find a good hotel in their home town and go there - its cheaper and easier. This hotel IS NOT a 7* palace and it does not advertise itself as such. like wise (to the people who question the quality of the breakfast) it is not a michlin starred restaurant. With this in mind, if you want a quality breakfast (whilst not compromising on convenience too much) try the wintergarten (two streets away off the Kdam) - it is a specialist in providing breakfast (rather than hotel rooms) and does so at a similar price to the art hotel. The only justified problem that has been brought up in other reviews is the noise levels in the rooms to the front of the hotel. The walls do not seem to offer sufficient insulation to keep out tire noise which some (shallow sleeping) guests might find annoying. however, there are plenty of rooms which do not face the road and therefore do not suffer this problem. All in all. if you are looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable, clean hotel situated in a very good location; this is the one for you. However, if you want 7* luxury - the Berlin Ritz is also a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: BowBell
Reviews.Content: I am perhaps not going to be totally objective in my review of this hotel since I stayed here having been bumped from my favourite Berlin hotel, the Palace... Pros: fantastic location just off the Ku-damm, great free WiFi connection in the lobby, friendly and efficient staff Cons: rooms are small, bed uncomfortable, very noisy - make sure you take earplugs with you In summary - this hotel offers a "jazzed" up version of an IBIS hotel and should only be considered if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as Some of the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: MAOCPAC
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after friends recommended it on their last trip to Berlin. Then I read the reviews on this site and had thought about cancelling but felt we would try it. Hotel not so bad. We were told on check-in that their was additional charge for breakfast. Room was small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rrp20
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Budapest version of an Art'Otel a few years ago, I was looking forward to my stay in this hotel- and given that it was close to where I was working I thought that I had stumbled upon a gem. However, I'm disappointed to say that the reality did not match my expectations. First big shock is the lack of 'art' around the place... but then I am willing to admit that I'm not an art expert, so maybe I missed these treasures. The reception area is clean and tidy and the bar area certainly looks like it belongs in a design hotel. There is a decent wifi connection on the ground floor, but nothing once you venture to your room. A shame, as I was travelling on business and this was a major irritation. I booked a standard room. It was a nice size room, a jazzy / artsy carpet and a comfortable bed. The 70s lingered in the bathroom and the poor quality of the towels was another annoyance. Little touches such as toiletries (shampoo, soap etc) were replaced with tubs of generic soap attached to the wall... functional, but lacks that little sense of luxury that you want from a hotel. The biggest problem for me was the noise at night. A room on the front of the hotel is unbearable because of the noise from the nightclub opposite. I had to move rooms (and pay €20 for the 'upgrade') to the back of the building. I'm not an early riser, so perhaps this is a lesson to me, but the breakfast was atrocious. There were plenty of sausages floating in tepid water, but little else by way of hot food. When they did finally notice that the scrambled eggs had run out and refilled it, the hungry hoards descended, leaving a few scraps. I gave up all hope of having any eggs for breakfast at all. That said, the cheese selection was good and the bread rolls were still warm, which is a nice treat. I certainly won't be staying here again, and I would only recommend this hotel for those who need to be near KaDeWe, but can't afford the Swissotel on the corner. Given the multitude of other design hotels in Berlin (and plenty near the ku'damm already!) this is a truly mediocre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night and would not recommend staying here unless you're on a budget. The room was around $100euro and the location is great - right on the KuDamm. However, the rooms are terrible - small, not the cleanest, and the beds aren't that comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “As artistic as a trip to an Ikea filled with pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: Roskolnikov
Reviews.Content: Mediocre room with a fine view of the dumpster. Decor chosen by someone who'd evidently spent a month locked up in Ikea. Low shower water pressure. Breakfast purportedly free, according to Priceline, and never posted as otherwise, but at checkout staff charged us 12 euro per person per day for scrambled eggs and wurst remnants. Other than that, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, but clean”
Reviews.Author: MereteJ
Reviews.Content: It's a matter of taste, of course, but I found the fabled art of this hotel to be nothing but tacky decor. Personally, I found it to be one of the least tasteful Berlin hotels I have stayed in. Decoration aside, my room was very clean and large, the staff was very nice and the breakfast was amazing. My main problem was that my room faced the very noisy Joachimstalerstrasse - even with the windows closed, the noise was very bad, also at night. The ventilation system in the bathroom drived me nuts - an hour after you had been to the bathroom, it would still make a very loud humming noise like a vacuum cleaner. Can't say anything about the price, as I was invited to stay there - the neighbourhood is a matter of taste as well: If you want the most garish and touristy side of Berlin, you have come to the right place. If cozy and laid back is your thing, stay in the area around Oranienburger Strasse instead.

Reviews.Title: “Sorat Art'otel”
Reviews.Author: orimeep
Reviews.Content: Was a bit freaked out by some of the earlier reviews, but it was one of the few hotels available when I was in Berlin and it was across the street from where I needed to be, so thought I would try it out. I was pleasantly surprised, especially comparing it to the Ambassador Hotel (another Sorat property), where I stayed the first two nights. I thought the decor was interesting, the room was clean and spacious, and the staff friendly. There was a great breakfast in the morning and it was nice to sit on the terrace with a glass of wine at night. The biggest drawback was that there is only internet access in the lobby and bar...however, it was free, so I just took my laptop down to the bar terrace and hung out there. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I should have stayed somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: missjos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really convenient location. The front desk isn't very helpful, there is no bell service, and the bathroom could use a deep cleaning. When I checked in, the front desk told me I had one of the nicest rooms in the hotel. I can't imagine how awful the other rooms must have been if I the room I stayed in was considered nice. Luckily I was only in the that hotel for two nights. I really saw alot of Berlin because I hated staying in that hotel. I should have looked into staying at the Swisshotel just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and well looked after”
Reviews.Author: Tolroy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights in at the art'hotel and for a 3 star could not fault it. Excellent position for transport links and near main shopping street, 1st class breakfast, free internet in lobby, friendly staff. Rooms simple but everything one needs.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Sorat Art Hotel-Berlin”
Reviews.Author: robertjrossonwye
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend at the Hotel, nice clean room. Attractive art on the walls and realy super designer bathroom. Rooms not over large but still a good size for a city centre Hotel. Nice garden for breakfast outside if the weather is good. Right in the centre for shopping or eating. Staff friendly and efficent. Nice little Bar/Resturant next door serves good food and beer. Reccomend for a weekend break or longer

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and going to the zoo but...”
Reviews.Author: Navigator10
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Berlin and stayed at three hotels, The Grand Hyatt, The Radisson and this hotel. This hotel was the least expensive, clean (even the towels are laid out on the bed for your inspection) and with walking distance of a very nice restaurant called Restaurant Dressler. Great for dinner for around $50.00. It doesn't need more business because of it's location. I overheard the staff turn down a visitor who came off the street. Booked up. Since the hotel is rather small, it has free computer access in the lobby next to the front desk instead of a doorman or consierge. I always find unfamiliar computers to be a pain and this one was no exception. Hard to use. The breakfast room was sunny and well stocked. The highlight of my stay. The lowlight was the accidentally activating the Adult/Movie channel that tacked on a 9.90 Euro charge to my bill for six minutes of time that they said I was watching this channel. Be very careful with that remote control. The staff never seemed to smile and I think the reason is that this TV system forces them to argue with customers like me. Stay at the Swissotel nearby and pay the extra money if you want to stay in this area of Berlin. The big department store is a few blocks away. Airport transportation is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Chic? Discreet?? Avant-Garde???”
Reviews.Author: Dschm88629
Reviews.Content: Chic? Discreet?? Avant-garde??? More like cheesy, tacky and worst of all -- dirty. I selected Sorat Artotel as part of a 3-night package based on the Frommer's review. We moved to another hotel at additional expense after the first night. The décor might have been avant-garde 5 to 7 years ago, but it only reminded me of bad college student art now. The rooms are tiny and there was a persistent sewer smell in the bathroom. The street noise was intense despite being on the sixth floor. The service was non-existent and the staff was clueless. Frommer's needs to get back out there -- the very fact that this place is even recommended calls into question Frommer's reputation and trustworthiness.

HotelInfo.Name: art'otel Berlin Kudamm
HotelInfo.Address: Joachimstaler Strasse 28 - 29, 10719 Berlin, Germany
